title: API Documentation
text:
Welcome to our comprehensive API documentation. This guide will help you get started with our RESTful API.

This content is wrapped in a container div but should still be included.

subsections.title: Getting Started
subsections.text:
To begin using our API, you'll need to register for an API key and understand the basic concepts.

  • Base URL: https://api.example.com/v1
  • Authentication: API Key required
  • Rate limit: 1000 requests per hour

subsections.title: Authentication
subsections.text:
All API requests require authentication using your API key:

curl -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" https://api.example.com/v1/users

Important: Keep your API key secure and never expose it in client-side code.

subsections.title: Endpoints
subsections.text: Our API provides several endpoints for different operations:

subsections.title: Data Endpoints
subsections.text: Access and manipulate data through these endpoints.

subsections.title: Working with JSON
subsections.text:
All API responses are in JSON format. Here's an example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": 123,
    "name": "John Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com"
  }
}

subsections.title: Error Handling
subsections.text:
Our API uses standard HTTP status codes and provides detailed error messages.

Status Code Description
200 Success
400 Bad Request
401 Unauthorized
404 Not Found

subsections.title: Support
subsections.text:
If you need help, please:

  1. Check our FAQ section
  2. Search the documentation
  3. Contact us at support@example.com

Last updated: December 1, 2023

Example API Team
https://example.com
